p: Cloudinary is a obsidian plugin for uploading content (images, video, audio) to Cloudinary Media Library and rendering them in your Obsidian notes. So that your memory will be well managed and also you use this for blog posts in astro or markdown.
You can customize the upload behaviour and transformation options for each content type and each folder in you vault.
To get started with this plugin, do either of the following:
Enable the plugin in your Obsidian Vault under Settings Community Plugins Installed Plugins
Go to Settings Community Plugins Browse
Each content type take its own transformation parameters.
If empty it will upload to the root of your Media Library.
If you want to have each of the content types uploaded to respective folders under the folder you mentioned.
If you want to have transformations while rendering the image. (Original files will be uploaded to CDN, Transformation will be applied while fetching the image)
If you want to have transformations while rendering the image. (Original files will be uploaded to CDN, Transformation will be applied while fetching)
If you want to upload other types of content, such as video & audio, you can add them here.
If you want to upload to a specific folder in your Cloudinary Media Library, enter the folder name here. If you leave this blank, all uploads will be stored in the root of your Media Library.
This is found under Settings / Uploads
To configure the Plugin, you'll need the following information:
Log in to Cloudinary and find your Cloud Name here Cloudinary Settings
Add Upload Preset This is found under Settings / Uploads Add Upload Preset
Check Preset This is found under Settings / Uploads Uploads Preset

When configuring the Global Upload Preset is a must, you can leave Global Upload Folder blank to have the pictures uploaded to the root of your Media Library. If you do put a folder name in this field, all images will be stored in a subdirectory of that name in your Media Library.
